content.description:
This route was essentially soloed by Clint in 1996 as a way to get back out of the corridor.  He returned in 2016 to place three bolts.  The crux is 5-10 feet above the third bolt.  Belay at trees on top.

Note that there are a lot of pine needles on the slopes above the rock. Be careful moving on these with rock shoes.
content.protection: Three protection bolts plus slings to wrap around a tree for an anchor on top.
content.location: At the bottom of the rappel into the corridor, head south down the corridor for about 100 feet and spot a small pillar of rock with grass on the west wall. Climb up this pillar.  You should see the three bolts directly above.

climbs.name: Bruce's Escape
climbs.fa: Bruce Hildenbrand and Clint Cummins, April 5, 2016

content.description:
This route was established as a way to get out of the corridor after climbing on North and South Yak.  It follows a pretty prominent right facing dihedral with a large crack in the back.  Use chimney and off width techniques to climb up 15 feet to the first bolt.  At the top of the dihedral clip a second bolt.  Surmount the roof and belay at a tree above.

Be careful walking on the pine needles above the climb.  They can be slippery in rock shoes.
content.protection: Two protection bolts plus slings for a tree anchor on top.
content.location: From the bottom of the rappel into the corridor head south about 100' passing Clint's Escape to a prominent right facing dihedral on the west side.  Two bolts should be visible from below the route.

climbs.name: Beast of Burden
climbs.fa: Dave Parks and Stu Polack, December 1982

content.description:
This route climbs the rappel line from the top of Behind the Yaks into the corridor with North and South Yak.  Five bolts protect the line which trends slightly to the right and then back left.  Be careful.  It's a long way to the first bolt and even though the climbing is not that difficult you are a long way from rescue.

Since you will most likely rappel in to start this route it is easy to toprope.
content.location: Find the rappel anchor into the corridor.  It's two bolts with double ring hangers.
